text: Yahweh Remembers Israel’s Faithfulness
And the word of Yahweh came to me, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 2:1 \ft Literally “to say” \f*
“Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, ⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Literally “to say” \f* ‘Thus says Yahweh,
“I remember \add concerning\add* you the loyal love of your childhood,\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Or “youth” \f*
the love of your betrothal-time,
your going\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Or “walking” \f* after me in the desert,\f + \fr 2:2 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
in \add the\add* land not sown.
Israel \add was\add* holy to Yahweh,
the first fruit of his produce.
All \add those who\add* ate it were held guilty;
disaster came to them,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:3 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.’ ”
The Unfaithfulness of Israel’s Ancestors
Hear the word of Yahweh, \add O\add* house of Jacob, and all the clans\f + \fr 2:4 \ft Or “families” \f* of the house of Israel.
Thus says Yahweh:
“What injustice did your ancestors\f + \fr 2:5 \ft Or “fathers” \f* find in me
that they were far from me,
and they went after the vanity,
and they became vain?
And they did not say,
‘Where \add is\add* Yahweh,
the one who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
the one who led us in the desert,\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
in a land of desert plains and gorges,\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Hebrew “gorge” \f*
in a land of dryness and deep darkness,
in a land ⸤that no one passes through⸥,\f + \fr 2:6 \ft Literally “no man passes through in it” \f*
and no human lives there?’
And I brought you to the land of the orchard,
to eat its fruit, and its good things.\f + \fr 2:7 \ft Hebrew “good thing” \f*
But you entered and defiled my land,
and my inheritance you made a detestable thing.\f + \fr 2:7 \ft Or “abomination” \f*
The priests did not say, ‘Where \add is\add* Yahweh?’
and those who handle the law did not know me,
and the shepherds have ⸤rebelled against me⸥,\f + \fr 2:8 \ft Literally “broken with me” \f*
and the prophets prophesied by Baal,
and they went after \add things which\add* do not profit.
The Unfaithfulness of Contemporary Israel
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* I again bring a lawsuit against you,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh,
“and with ⸤your children⸥\f + \fr 2:9 \ft Literally “sons of your sons” \f* I bring a lawsuit.
For go over \add to\add* the coasts of Cyprus and look,
and send \add to\add* Kedar and consider very closely,
and see if there has been \add a thing\add* like this:
Has a nation exchanged gods? And they \add are\add* not gods!
But my people have exchanged their glory for that which does not profit.
Be appalled, \add O\add* heavens, at this, and shudder;
be utterly desolate,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:12 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“For my people have committed two evils:
they have forsaken me, \add the\add* source\f + \fr 2:13 \ft Or “fountain” \f* of living water,
to hew out for themselves cisterns, cracked cisterns that can hold no water.
\add Is\add* Israel a slave? Or ⸤a slave born in a house⸥?\f + \fr 2:14 \ft Literally “born of a house” \f*
Why has he become plunder?
\add The\add* young lions have roared against him,
they have ⸤raised⸥\f + \fr 2:15 \ft Literally “given” \f* their voices.\f + \fr 2:15 \ft Hebrew “voice” \f*
And they have made his land as horror;
his cities are destroyed, ⸤without⸥\f + \fr 2:15 \ft Literally “from not” \f* an inhabitant.
Moreover, people of Memphis and Tahpanhes
will ⸤shave⸥\f + \fr 2:16 \ft Literally “pasture” \f* your skull.\f + \fr 2:16 \ft Or “crown of your head” \f*
Did you not do this to yourself,
\add by\add* forsaking Yahweh, your God,
at the time of your leading in the way?
And now ⸤why do you go⸥\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Literally “what for you” \f* the way of Egypt
to drink the waters of the Shihor?
And ⸤why do you go⸥\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Literally “what for you” \f* the way of Assyria
to drink the waters of the ⸤Euphrates⸥?\f + \fr 2:18 \ft Literally “river” \f*
Your wickedness will chastise you,
and your apostasies will reprove you.
Therefore know and see that \add it is\add* evil and bitter,
your forsaking of Yahweh, your God,
and fear of me \add is\add* not in you,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:19 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.
“For from long ago you have broken your yoke,
you tore to pieces your bonds.
And you said, ‘I will not serve!’
But on every high hill and under every leafy tree
you \add were\add* lying down \add as\add* a prostitute.
Yet I planted you \add as\add* a choice vine,
all of it a seed of trustworthiness.
How then have you altered before me
\add into something that is\add* degenerate, the foreign vine?
For if you wash with natron,
and you ⸤use much soap⸥,\f + \fr 2:22 \ft Literally “make numerous for yourself alkaline salt” \f*
your guilt \add is\add* sticking as a stain ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 2:22 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* me,”
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:22 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* the Lord Yahweh.
“How can you say, ‘I have not defiled myself,
I have not gone after the Baals?’
Look at your way in the valley,
know what you have done.
\add You are\add* a young she-camel,
interweaving her ways.
A wild ass accustomed to \add the\add* desert,\f + \fr 2:24 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
in the desire of her soul.
She gasps \add for\add* wind \add in\add* her rutting time.
Who can quell\f + \fr 2:24 \ft Or “restrain” \f* her \add lust\add*?
All \add those who\add* seek her will not grow weary,
in her month they will find her.
Restrain your foot from \add being\add* barefoot,
and your throat from thirst.
But you said, ‘\add It is\add* hopeless.
No! For I have loved strangers,
and after them I will go.’\f + \fr 2:25 \ft Or “walk” \f*
As \add the\add* shame of a thief when he is caught in the act,
so the house of Israel will be ashamed.
They, their kings, their officials,
and their priests, and their prophets.
\add Those who\add* say to the tree, ‘You \add are\add* my father,’
and to the stone, ‘You gave birth \add to\add* me.’
For they have turned \add their\add* ⸤backs⸥\f + \fr 2:27 \ft Literally “neck” \f* to me, and not \add their\add* faces.
But in the time of their trouble they say, ‘Arise and save us.’
But where \add are\add* your gods that you made for yourself?
Let them arise if they can save you in the time of your trouble.
For \add according to\add* the number of your towns
are your gods, \add O\add* Judah.
Why do you complain to me?
All of you have ⸤rebelled against me⸥,”\f + \fr 2:29 \ft Literally “broken with me” \f* ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 2:29 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“For ⸤in vain⸥\f + \fr 2:30 \ft Literally “the vanity” \f* I have struck your children.
They accepted no discipline.
Your sword devoured your prophets,
like a ravening\f + \fr 2:30 \ft Or “destroying” \f* lion.
O generation, you see the word of Yahweh.
Have I been a desert\f + \fr 2:31 \ft Or “wilderness” \f* to Israel? Or a land of great darkness?
Why do my people say, ‘We roam about freely,
we will not come again to you’?
Can a young woman forget her ornaments?\f + \fr 2:32 \ft Or “jewelry” \f* \add Or\add* a bride her sashes?
Yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
How well you do \add on\add* your way to seek love!
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 2:33 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* even \add to\add* the wicked \add woman\add* you can teach your ways.
Also on your skirts is found
\add the\add* blood of \add the\add* life of \add the\add* innocent, \add the\add* poor.
You did not find them in the act of breaking into a house.
But in spite of all these \add things\add*,
yet you say, ‘But I am innocent,
surely his anger has turned away from me.’
Look, I \add am\add* entering into judgment with you
because of your saying, ‘I have not sinned.’
How you go about so much changing your way!
Also by Egypt you will be put to shame,
just as you were put to shame by Assyria.
Also from there you will come out
with your hands on your head,
for Yahweh has rejected ⸤those in whom you trust⸥,\f + \fr 2:37 \ft Literally “in your objects of trust” \f*
and you will not prosper through them.
